name: arstechnica
text:
If you love to read, you'll love the Kindle Paperwhite: https://t.co/fjxbafWLaa

It was maybe the best value in e-reading when it was updated in 2018. And Amazon has sweetened that even more for #PrimeDay in 2020: https://t.co/99hQCCXDgB https://t.co/x9b5l1Btry

name: arstechnica
text:
It didn't change much (except the much maligned keyboard), but we enjoyed the 2020 MacBook Air https://t.co/wEc7DMKy62

And on #PrimeDay, it's the rare Apple laptop you can nab for less than $1,000 (~$850): https://t.co/PjcQvyfnc3 https://t.co/5giW5nyw57

name: arstechnica
text: It took a couple of years, but #Apple finally has a smart speaker that's priced to compete with affordable offerings from competitors Google, Amazon, and Sonos. Meet the #HomePodMini: https://t.co/TRBRKyp8Mp https://t.co/93CIrKiK1W

name: arstechnica
text: #Apple finally announced the #iPhone12 (and the iPhone 12 Mini, and the iPhone 12 Pro, and the iPhone 12 Pro Max, and...) https://t.co/3JISl1zBfm https://t.co/rZdxFfT0BQ

name: arstechnica
text: Since our first #PrimeDay roundup went live, we've found a number of new deals worth highlighting—including Super Mario Odyssey for $40, discounts on recommended board games like Splendor and Ticket to Ride—Europe, and more. https://t.co/9WgkktVPIG https://t.co/KSgj9b3Xiz
